page.title: 07Trout Brook, near Winford
page.content: The best local fishing is in the trout stream called "Little John" Water. It is about five feet deep after rain, but two feet in dry times and very narrow. The stream runs from Barrow Tanks then through a long pipe. We call it Winford Brook. There are four different fish in the stream: rainbow trout, brown trout, perch and roach. The biggest trout caught down there was 3lb 2oz. That was a rainbow trout. The stream runs past Winford Road Garage and into a reservoir at Chew Magna. A few people fish there but I find the best place to be is at the weir. The bait we use is bread and worms. There is a five pound trout down there to be caught.I caught it when it was smaller but released it.
